com.xing.api.resources

Class ContactsResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xing.api.Resource
      • com.xing.api.resources.ContactsResource

  • public class ContactsResource
extends Resource
    Represent the 'Contacts' resource.

    Provides methods which allow access a user's contact list, as well as read, send and respond to contact requests.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.xing.api.Resource

    • Method Detail

      • getUserContacts

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<XingUser>,HttpError> getUserContacts(java.lang.String userId)
        Returns the requested user’s contacts.

        No more than 100 contacts at once (see limit parameter) can be requested, but several requests in parallel can be performed. If executed with limit=0 only the number of contacts will be returned.

        If the authorizing user does not have access to the requested user’s contacts, the value for the user’s key will be null (not an empty list!).

        By default this call can only access the contacts of the authorizing user direct contacts, i.e. second-level contacts. For further level access, please get in touch with the support team.

        Possible optional query parameters:

        Parameter Name Description
        limit Restrict the number of attachments to be returned. Must be a positive number. Default: 10
        offset Offset. Must be a positive number. Default: 0
        order_by Field that determines the ascending order of the returned list. Currently only "last_name" is supported. Defaults to "id"
        user_fields List of user attributes to be returned. If not used, only the ID will be returned. For a list of available profile user attributes, refer to the user profile representation.
        Parameters:
        userId - Id of the user who's contact list should be returned.
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        'Get contacts' resource page

      • getOwnContacts

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<XingUser>,HttpError> getOwnContacts()
        Returns the authorizing user’s contacts.

        No more than 100 contacts at once (see limit parameter) can be requested, but several requests in parallel can be performed. If executed with limit=0 only the number of contacts will be returned.

        If the authorizing user does not have access to the requested user’s contacts, the value for the user’s key will be null (not an empty list!).

        By default this call can only access the contacts of the authorizing user direct contacts, i.e. second-level contacts. For further level access, please get in touch with the support team.

        Possible optional query parameters:

        Parameter Name Description
        changed_since Filter contacts that changed since the specified date (ISO 8601). The date can be up to 24 hours in the past. If an earlier date is specified, 24 hours in the past will be used instead. This parameter can only be used when the user_id parameter is set the to current user.
        limit Restrict the number of attachments to be returned. Must be a positive number. Default: 10
        offset Offset. Must be a positive number. Default: 0
        order_by Field that determines the ascending order of the returned list. Currently only "last_name" is supported. Defaults to "id"
        user_fields List of user attributes to be returned. If not used, only the ID will be returned. For a list of available profile user attributes, refer to the user profile representation.
        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        'Get contacts' resource page

      • getOwnContactsIds

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<java.lang.String>,HttpError> getOwnContactsIds()
        Returns all contact IDs of the authorizing user.

        If only the number on contacts is required, use getOwnContacts() with limit=0.

        Returns:
        A callSpec object ready to execute the request.
        See Also:
        'Get the current user's contact IDs' resource page

        Parameters:

        userId - ID of the user who assigned the tags.

      • getOwnAssignedTags

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<java.lang.String>,HttpError> getOwnAssignedTags(java.lang.String contactId)
        Retrieve assigned tags by current user. Retrieve all tags the current user has assigned to a contact. Basically works the same as getAssignedTags(String, String), but already putting the user id as ME.
        Parameters:
        contactId - ID of the users contact.

      • getSharedContacts

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<XingUser>,HttpError> getSharedContacts(java.lang.String userId)
        Get shared contacts. Returns the list of contacts who are direct contacts of both the given and the current user. The nested user data this call returns are the same as the get user details call. You can’t request more than 100 shared contacts at once (see limit parameter), but you can perform several requests in parallel. If you execute this call with limit=0, it will tell you how many contacts the user has without returning any user data.

        If the current user doesn’t have access to the requested user’s contacts, he isn’t allowed to see how many contacts he has in common with the requested user. In contrast to the get contacts call, this call will fail and return a 403 message instead.

        Possible OPTIONAL parameters

        Parameter Name Description
        limit Restrict the number of attachments to be returned. This must be a positive number. Default: 10
        offset Offset. This must be a positive number. Default: 0
        order_by Field that determines the ascending order of the returned list. Currently only supports "last_name". Defaults to "id"
        user_fields List of user attributes to return. If this parameter is not used, only the ID will be returned. For a list of available profile user attributes, please refer to the get user details call. XingUser

      • getUpcomingBirthdays

        @Experimental
public CallSpec<java.util.List<XingUser>,HttpError> getUpcomingBirthdays()
        Retrieve upcoming birthdays

        Possible OPTIONAL parameters

        Parameter Name Description
        user_fields List of user attributes to return. If this parameter is not used, only the ID will be returned. For a list of available profile user attributes, please refer to the get user details call. XingUser

      • getIncomingContactRequests

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<ContactRequest>,HttpError> getIncomingContactRequests()
        Get incoming contact requests. Lists all pending incoming contact requests the specified user has received from other users.

        Possible OPTIONAL parameters

        Paramter Name Description
        limit Restricts the number of contact requests to be returned. This must be a positive number. Default: 10
        offset Offset. This must be a positive number. Default: 0
        user_fields List of user attributes to return. If this parameter is not used, only the ID will be returned. For a list of available profile fields, please refer to the example response below. All top-level attributes (e.g. id, page_name, photo_urls,…) are valid fields. It is also possible to get an even more detailed response, e.g photo_urls.medium or professional_experience.primary_company.name XingUser

      • getPendingContactRequests

        public CallSpec<java.util.List<PendingContactRequest>,HttpError> getPendingContactRequests()
        Get sent contact requests. Lists all pending contact requests the specified user has sent.

        Possible OPTIONAL parameters

        Paramter Name Description
        limit Restricts the number of contact requests to be returned. This must be a positive number. Default: 10
        offset Offset. This must be a positive number. Default: 0
        recipient_id Filter the contact requests for a given user ID.

      • sendContactRequest

        public CallSpec<java.lang.Void,HttpError> sendContactRequest(java.lang.String userId)
        Initiate a contact request. Initiates a contact request between the current user (sender) and the specified user (recipient).

        Possible OPTIONAL parameters

        Paramter Name Description
        message Message attached to the contact request
        Parameters:
        userId - ID of the user receiving the contact request

      • acceptContactRequest

        public CallSpec<java.lang.Void,HttpError> acceptContactRequest(java.lang.String recipientId,
                                                               java.lang.String senderId)
        Accept contact request. Accepts an incoming contact request.
        Parameters:
        recipientId - Recipient ID
        senderId - Sender ID

      • revokeContactRequest

        public CallSpec<java.lang.Void,HttpError> revokeContactRequest(java.lang.String recipientId,
                                                               java.lang.String senderId)
        Revoke or deny contact request. Denies an incoming contact request or revokes an initiated contact request.

        There is a limit on the number of contact requests you can revoke. Currently this limit is 20 contact requests within 5 days.

        If you try to revoke more contact requests this call will reply with ACCESS_DENIED and you have to wait for 7 days until you can start revoking requests again.

        Parameters:
        recipientId - Recipient ID
        senderId - Sender ID

      • getContactPaths

        public CallSpec<ContactPaths,HttpError> getContactPaths(java.lang.String userId,
                                                        java.lang.String otherUserId)
        Get contact path(s). Get the shortest contact path(s) between a user and any other XING user.

        Possible OPTIONAL parameters

        Paramter Name Description
        all_paths Specifies whether this call returns just one contact path (default) or all contact paths. Possible values are true or false. Default: false
        user_fields Comma-separated list of user attributes to return in nested user objects (along with the ID). If empty, only the ID will be returned.
        Parameters:
        userId - ID of the user whose contact path(s) are to be returned
        otherUserId - ID of any other XING user

      • inviteByMail

        public CallSpec<InvitationStats,HttpError> inviteByMail(java.lang.String... emails)
        Send an Invite to XING to a user via E-Mail Send invitations via email to contacts who do not have a XING profile. The user is allowed to invite 2000 people per week.

        Possible OPTIONAL parameters

        Paramter Name Description
        message Message that is sent together with the invitation. The maximum length of this message is 150 characters for BASIC users and 600 characters for PREMIUM users. Defaults to the XING standard text for invitations.
        user_fields List of user attributes to be returned. If this parameter is not used, only the ID will be returned. For a list of available profile user attributes, please refer to the get user details call. XingUser
        Parameters:
        emails - List of one or more comma-separated email addresses. NOTE: The current user’s email address will be filtered out.
